After PM's resignation, Macron hints at snap elections
subhead: President Emmanuel Macron gave Sébastien Lecornu 48 hours to resolve the crisis, saying he will 'take his responsibilities' if efforts fail. The move was a way of pushing the Socialists and conservatives toward compromise.

title: At the Jubillar trial, too much and too little in the first two weeks
subhead: Everything was on display even before the trial of Cédric Jubillar, who is accused of killing his wife, Delphine. Yet impatience is growing as the October 17 verdict approaches.

title: First day of Hamas-Israel talks in Egypt ends on 'positive' note, mediators say
subhead: The first day of indirect talks between Hamas and Israel concluded in Cairo on Monday 'amid a positive atmosphere,' with US President Donald Trump saying Hamas is agreeing 'to things that are very important.'

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics rewards research into quantum mechanical tunneling
subhead: John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis were presented with the award for their work, which provides opportunities to develop 'the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors.'

title: With Matthieu Blazy, Chanel dives into a new universe
subhead: The French-Belgian designer's first show for Chanel on Monday was one of the most highly anticipated events of Paris Fashion Week. His flair for craftsmanship and the elegance of Gabrielle Chanel blended seamlessly in this spring-summer 2026 collection.

Sweden's new list of 'cultural values' sparks controversy
subhead: 'Pippi Longstocking,' Ikea, Bergman: In early September, Sweden's conservative government unveiled a list aimed at defining a 'common frame of reference' to promote the integration of foreigners. The opposition has condemned the project's nostalgic vision.

title: Sébastien Lecornu's full speech after resigning
subhead: After submitting his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, Sébastien Lecornu, who served for 27 days as prime minister, delivered a speech on Monday morning.

title: Tony Blair's denial of Palestine
subhead: The close ties between former British prime minister Tony Blair and Benjamin Netanyahu have made him a key player in Donald Trump's plan for Gaza, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.
